posts.cooked:
Hi CD ! Our shooter, just started to make a clicking noise, upon closer inspection, it seems to be the belt. But the internet only provides results for car timing belts or it’s a different part of it. Any clarifications onto what it may be and will it be a problem? IMG_20240315_141932259 1920×2560 216 KB IMG_20240315_141940032 3120×4160 529 KB IMG_20240315_141945731 3120×4160 550 KB

IMG_20240315_141932259 1920×2560 216 KB

posts.name: Max H.
posts.cooked: It could be the belt skipping or the gears meshing, can you post a video of the noise?

posts.name: Dan Langdon
posts.cooked: It could also be the belt being slightly too tight and the teeth dropping down in the pulley.  We have experienced this.  It is has not been a huge issue other than ever so slight of drag to the system in our case
If you hear a clicking, it is most likely something to do with the flanges on metal pulleys becoming loose, or your bearings. I’d check for bearing failures.

Sorry, I can’t provide a video as CD doesn’t allow the video format my phone produces, but the belt doesn’t seem to be skipping and the gears are not skipping. Thank you for your response! (The sound sounds like a ratchet clicking)
I think this could be the case, as the belt I noticed after you said this is incredibly tensioned. It makes the sound each time a tooth goes over the pulley

posts.name: Owen Murtha
posts.cooked: Could you upload the video to youtube or google drive?

I’ve also experienced this before. Apart from making the shooter incredibly loud, it doesn’t have a significant negative effect on the shooter, however, you are losing a small bit of efficiency due to the belt being overtensioned. If the belt makes the click on the same spot each rotations, its most likely caused by overtensioning.
